title: The Walking Dead, Vol. 1: Days Gone Bye
author: Robert Kirkman, Tony Moore
description: Rick Grimes, a sheriff’s deputy, awakens from a coma to find the world overrun by zombies. This volume collects issues #1–6 and begins his harrowing journey through a post‑apocalyptic America.

title: Why Men Love Bitches: From Doormat to Dreamgirl
author: Sherry Argov
description: A bold relationship guide advocating that confident, self-respecting women—those who stand their ground—are more attractive to men than passive doormats.

title: One Wrong Step
author: Jennifer A. Nielsen
description: Twelve‑year‑old Atlas Wade must brave an avalanche on Mount Everest in 1939 to rescue his father and others, confronting grief, survival, and the looming threat of WWII.

title: Resistance
author: Jennifer A. Nielsen
description: Set in Nazi-occupied Poland, teenager Chaya Lindner uses forged identity papers and courage to carry food, documents, and people between Jewish ghettos, later joining a resistance cell amid the Warsaw Ghetto Uprising.

title: The Genealogy Do-Over Workbook
author: Thomas MacEntee
description: A practical workbook guiding genealogists step‑by‑step through re‑evaluating and improving their research processes, with checklists, worksheets, and a year‑long ‘do‑over’ plan.

title: Machine Learning System Design Interview
author: Ali Aminian, Alex Xu
description: Provides a 7‑step framework and 10 real‑world ML system design interview questions—such as recommendation systems, search, content detection—supported by 211 diagrams to help engineers prepare for ML design interviews.

title: Angel Numbers: The Angels Explain the Meaning of 111, 444, and Other Numbers in Your Life
author: Doreen Virtue, Lynnette Brown
description: A guide to understanding the spiritual messages behind recurring number sequences—111, 444, 777, etc.—and how angels use them to communicate guidance in everyday life.

title: The Housemaid's Secret
author: Freida McFadden
description: Millie, a housemaid with a mysterious past, takes a job with the wealthy Garrick family—and soon uncovers chilling secrets, blood-stained nightgowns, and a web of deceit that threatens everyone in the penthouse.

title: Glass Houses: The Morganville Vampires – Book One
author: Rachel Caine
description: When college freshman Claire Danvers moves into a house in Morganville, Texas, she discovers her roommates are protective, strange—and the town is run by vampires. She must navigate a deadly secret world to survive.

title: Roller Girl
author: Victoria Jamieson
description: Astrid enters roller derby camp one summer and discovers independence, friendship shifts, and self‑confidence through the sport—earning a Newbery Honor in the process.

title: Essentials of Health Policy and Law
author: Sara E. Wilensky, Joel B. Teitelbaum
description: A comprehensive introduction to U.S. health policy and law, covering topics like the Affordable Care Act, health insurance programs (Medicaid, Medicare, CHIP), public health preparedness, social determinants of health, and how to conduct policy analysis.

title: Lapvona: A Novel
author: Ottessa Moshfegh
description: Set in a brutal medieval fiefdom, a deformed 13‑year‑old shepherd’s son is swept into a power struggle involving witchcraft, famine, corruption, and ruthless nobility.

title: Essential Readings in Canadian Government and Politics, 2nd Edition
author: Peter H. Russell, François Rocher, Debra Elizabeth Thompson, Amanda Bittner
description: A curated collection of foundational essays, speeches, debates and reports covering Canadian political institutions, federalism, representative democracy, diversity, constitutional politics and the Charter—designed as an essential reader for Canadian politics courses.

title: HTML & CSS: Design and Build Websites
author: Jon Duckett
description: A visually rich, full‑color introduction to HTML and CSS that makes learning web design easy and engaging for beginners and professionals alike.

title: Star Wars: Darth Plagueis
author: James Luceno
description: A deep dive into the life and machinations of Darth Plagueis the Wise—the Sith Master of Palpatine—exploring his quest for immortality, political intrigue in the Galactic Senate, and the seeds of the dark side preceding the prequel era.

title: The Making of Social Theory: Order, Reason, and Desire
author: Anthony Thomson
description: A comprehensive second‑edition survey tracing Western social thought from medieval society to early 20th century sociology, featuring new chapters on Marxism and social democracy.

genre: Science Fiction & Fantasy / Urban Superhero Romance
title: Fire & Ice
author: T.L. Heinrich
description: Colleen, a vigilante in High Tide, faces family betrayal, forbidden romance, and federal agents as she navigates a dangerous showdown in this urban superhero fantasy.

title: What Are Tumors?
author: Herbert M. Shelton
description: A concise pamphlet-style examination of tumors from the perspective of natural hygiene, discussing causes, natural healing methods, and Shelton’s approach to disease.

title: The Study of Social Problems: Seven Perspectives
author: Earl Rubington, Martin S. Weinberg
description: A theoretical anthology organizing social problems through seven sociological lenses—social pathology, social disorganization, value conflict, deviant behavior, labeling, critical perspective, and social constructionism—commonly used in university-level sociology courses.

title: Antes de diciembre
author: Joana Marcús
description: A passionate Wattpad-born romance about Jenna Brown navigating long-distance relationships, new friendships, and unexpected love as she counts down to December.

title: The Troubleshooter's Guide to Do-It-Yourself Genealogy
author: W. Daniel Quillen
description: An advanced DIY genealogy guide offering investigative techniques, research insights, and strategies to overcome common roadblocks, with in‑depth coverage of census, military, probate, church records, and regional research.
